sub_concepts.name: Arctic Oscillation
sub_concepts.definition: A climate pattern characterized by winds circulating counterclockwise around the Arctic that can influence the strength and position of the polar vortex.

sub_concepts.name: Jet Stream
sub_concepts.definition: A narrow band of strong winds that circulate high in the atmosphere and can affect the movement and intensity of the polar vortex.

sub_concepts.name: Stratosphere
sub_concepts.definition: The layer of the Earth's atmosphere above the troposphere where the polar vortex forms and is influenced by changes in temperature and wind patterns.
